endings.title: GAME OVER: FRESH BREATHS
endings.subtitle: Ending 01/25
endings.s1:
The inbox stayed quiet. The calendar stayed empty. But the world didn’t end. You help her cook. You go on walks. You finally read that book you kept pretending to finish. It still stings, yeah. But you’re breathing. You’re still here. 

And for now, that’s enough.
endings.s2:
You: no luck this cycle. i think i’m just gonna take the L
Best Friend: rest. rebuild. you’ve earned both
Roommate: yeah. fr. we all hit walls
You: she said she’s proud of me anyway. idk why that made me cry
Best Friend: because it matters
oommate: she’s a real one
You: yeah. i think she is.

endings.title: GAME OVER: BURNT ACID
endings.subtitle: Ending 02/25
endings.s1:
The lab smells like ethanol and burnt silicon. You run tests, rerun tests, fix broken scripts, and spend hours pretending to understand a grad student's methodology notes. She walks you to campus sometimes. Brings you coffee when the experiments drag past midnight. There’s no funding. No recognition. But there’s something here. 

Something real.
endings.s2:
You: just spent 4 hours figuring out a bug caused by a loose USB cable
Roommate: bro… unpaid???
Best Friend: that’s kind of sick though
You: we got a result today. pi actually said “huh.” that’s the win
Roommate: you need hazard pay
Best Friend: you’ll remember this summer more than any of us
You: yeah. probably

endings.title: GAME OVER: STEADY GOES THE SHIP
endings.subtitle: Ending 03/25
endings.s1:
You work in a fluorescent-lit IT office two blocks from a courthouse. You fixed a printer jam, set up a Zoom call for someone named “Councilman Dickerson,” and spent your afternoon pretending to understand the city’s Wi-Fi contract. She still brings you lunch. Says she’s proud of how far you’ve come. You believe her. 

Even if no one else does.
endings.s2:
You: i just got thanked for resetting a password
Roommate: my man is the backbone of bureaucracy
Best Friend: that sounds… oddly heroic?
You: they told me i’m “one of the sharper ones”
Roommate: govtech legend
Best Friend: honestly i respect the grind
You: lol thanks. i’m surviving

endings.title: GAME OVER: STRATEGIC REALIGNMENT
endings.subtitle: Ending 04/25
endings.s1:
You’re not really sure what your job title means. Half your day is in Google Sheets, the other half is listening to people say “synergy” without flinching. She says she’s proud of you. Says it’s a way up. You believe her. Even if you don’t believe in the work.

And maybe that’s enough.
endings.s2:
You: client just asked if we could make the SaaS tool “more agile”
Roommate: bro’s in the fake tech mines
Best Friend: i’m glad you have stability though
You: i’m doing like 20% tech and 80% smiling
Roommate: consultants zzz
Best Friend: i’d still hire you before most of LinkedIn

endings.title: GAME OVER: FUNCTIONAL INTEGRATION
endings.subtitle: Ending 05/25
endings.s1:
You spend the summer tuning embedded systems in a windowless lab next to a factory line. It smells like oil and ozone. She visits once. Brings you iced coffee and calls the shop “kinda cool, actually.” You don’t talk about impact or changing the world. But the cars move. 

That’s all you need.
endings.s2:
You: spent the morning on EV battery diagnostics. it’s kinda fun
Best Friend: you sound like you’re thriving
Roommate: bro’s literally driving the future
You: she brought me lunch again lol
Best Friend: SHE’S A KEEPER
Roommate: stfu and just get me a free car you fucking simp

endings.title: GAME OVER: LEGACY MAINTAINED
endings.subtitle: Ending 06/25
endings.s1:
It’s beige walls, old ThinkPads, and meetings where people still say “synergy.” You spend most of your time rewriting COBOL wrappers for cloud services. She teases you about being a “tech historian,” but she’s the one who made you breakfast before your first day. It’s not cool. But it’s stable. 

And right now, stable feels like grace.
endings.s2:
You: first thing i did today was update a system older than me
Roommate: you’re in the trenches
Best Friend: proud of you for making legacy feel legendary
You: she says my badge pic looks like i just got drafted
Roommate: she’s not wrong
You: i kinda like it here though
Best Friend: then that’s all that matters

endings.title: GAME OVER: OPTIMIZED TRADEOFFS
endings.subtitle: Ending 07/25
endings.s1:
You’re mostly optimizing credit flows for people who will never know your name. The tech’s modern, the meetings are constant, and your deliverables have deliverables. But she listens when you rant about APIs and vaguely predatory interest models. She gets it. Or at least, she’s trying. And honestly? 

That means more than any promotion ever could.
endings.s2:
You: i built a dashboard today that got 12 stakeholders to shut up
Best Friend: oh so you’ve joined the middle-manager appeasement arc
Roommate: welcome to the spreadsheet-industrial complex
You: she bought me new blue light glasses. said it was “combat gear”
Best Friend: i love her
Roommate: bro’s cuffed and optimized

endings.title: GAME OVER: LOW PROFILE, HIGH FUNCTION
endings.subtitle: Ending 08/25
endings.s1:
Your badge doesn’t open the cool doors, but it opens enough. You write code for embedded systems no one talks about in the news. She meets you for lunch sometimes. She says it’s cute how serious you get about antenna calibration. It’s not flashy. It’s not glamorous. 

But for once, that doesn’t matter.
endings.s2:
You: spent 6 hours debugging an EOTS today. feel like i aged 10 years
Best Friend: you’ll be fine. my model just told the execs to kill a whole product line
Roommate: lmao try watching a chip fail post-silicon
You: i’d rather not
Best Friend: how’s she doing btw
You: she packed me lunch. i almost proposed
Roommate: simp

endings.title: GAME OVER: CUTTING EDGES, NOT CORNERS
endings.subtitle: Ending 09/25
endings.s1:
You work in a windowless building with badge scanners at every turn. The things you’re helping build will never have your name on them. And still—she calls. She asks how your day was. You lie, a little. But she gets it. 

Somehow, you don’t feel alone in this.
endings.s2:
You: can’t say what i’m doing. but it’s… heavy
Best Friend: emotionally? morally??
Roommate: physically??
You: yes
Roommate: she still dating you or did you get replaced by a drone
You: she made me lasagna last night
Best Friend: yeah he’s locked in fr
Roommate: fine. i support militarized love

endings.title: GAME OVER: ADDITIVE ASCENSION
endings.subtitle: Ending 10/25
endings.s1:
You spend your days prototyping parts no one’s ever built before. Industrial resin. Topology optimization. 200-micron tolerances. She sends playlists while you work. You send her videos of prints failing in spectacular fashion. It’s not glamorous. But it feels real. 

Like something worth building.
endings.s2:
You: got my first part approved for flight cert
Best Friend: THIS IS HUGE
Roommate: bro’s dating and innovating
You: she brought me coffee this morning. almost cried
Best Friend: wholesome king
Roommate: cringe
You: cope

endings.title: GAME OVER: THE WOLF OF WALL STREET
endings.subtitle: Ending 11/25
endings.s1:
The office feels like a spaceship. You spend your days speaking in acronyms and numbers, making decisions faster than thought. But at night, the pace slows. She calls. You talk. You laugh. 

Somehow, you’ve found someone who grounds you—even while you're helping move markets.
endings.s2:
You: my desk has six monitors. they gave me a keyboard with no letters
Best Friend: she’s gonna dump you if you turn into a quant bro
Roommate: bro ALREADY IS A quant
You: not true. i still have a soul
Best Friend: only bc she’s holding it for you
Roommate: enjoy your blood money
You: lmk when you start getting paid in anything

endings.title: GAME OVER: SILICON VALLEY DREAMS
endings.subtitle: Ending 12/25
endings.s1:
You board your flight to Cupertino with one carry-on and a DM from your now-girlfriend reading, “Call me when you land.” The office is sleek. The badge feels heavy. The workload is absurd. But you made it. You split fries over FaceTime that night. 

You’re both smiling.
endings.s2:
You: got the badge today.
Best Friend: oh my god. u better not become a silicon valley ghoul
Roommate: pics or she’s not real
Best Friend: no fr i wanna see her
You: you guys are insufferable
Roommate: she is too if she’s dating you lmao
Best Friend: LMAOOOOO
You: [sent a photo]

endings.title: GAME OVER: QUESTIONABLE RETURN ON INVESTMENT
endings.subtitle: Ending 13/25
endings.s1:
You’re in business school now. There’s a bitter convenience to it; a preordained pipeline for the kids who were once gifted and tired. No one asks why you gave up. You just kind of... stopped. Now you spend your days in case studies and coffee shops, talking about leverage like it's a religion. Quite simply, you let the fire go out. 

And sometimes, when the professor calls on you, you swear you can still feel the ghost of who you used to be.
endings.s2:
You: forgot my AirPods and had to raw dog a dumbass case discussion
Roommate: you’ve changed. you used to build stuff
Best Friend: now you just build debt 
You: stfu i’m networking
Roommate: business casual arc
Best Friend: business tragedy
You: i hate all of you
Roommate: dw u hate yourself more for selling out

endings.title: GAME OVER: DREAMS DEFERRED
endings.subtitle: Ending 25/25 (Canon Ending)
endings.s1:
You sleep in. Scroll past sunrise. Apply to jobs that don’t reply. The semester's over. The groupchats are quieter now. You tell yourself it’s temporary. That the market’s broken. That you'll be able to find someone to call yours. 

But you don’t believe it. Not really. You just close the tab. 

And lie back down in tears.
endings.s2:
You: no internships. nothing
Best Friend: i’m really sorry
Roommate: man. i don’t know what to say
You: it’s fine. just tired
Best Friend: it’s not fine. but you’re allowed to be tired
You: thanks
Roommate: we still got you
You: i know. just wish that was enough

endings.title: GAME OVER: INTERN, INTERRUPTED
endings.subtitle: Ending 15/25
endings.s1: You show up before the PI. You leave after the grad students. Your name’s misspelled on a poster that might be presented in Belgium. You don’t get paid. You don’t get credit. But for the first time, you feel like you’re part of something that might outlast you. Even if no one else notices.
endings.s2:
You: fixed a major data issue and the PI just called me “intern”
Roommate: nah that’s insane
Best Friend: i know it’s thankless, but i’m proud of you
You: my code’s probably going into a paper. that’s kinda cool, right?
Roommate: as long as it’s not just the acknowledgements section
Best Friend: it’s cool. even if they forget you, you’ll remember
You: yeah. i think i will

endings.title: GAME OVER: THE WOLF OF GOOGLE WORKSPACE
endings.subtitle: Ending 16/25
endings.s1:
It’s beige walls, clunky software, and coworkers who call you “the computer guy.” Your most exciting moment this week was deleting 700 rows of duplicated budget data. Nobody asks about your internship. You don’t bring it up. But the checks clear. You’re not unemployed. That’s enough. 

Right?
endings.s2:
You: just watched a guy print a 42-page doc to the wrong building
Roommate: lol. you gonna be okay man
Best Friend: you’re doing what you have to. i respect that
You: it’s quiet. i’m not gonna die here or anything
Roommate: “not gonna die here” is a wild benchmark
Best Friend: hey, still better than nothing
You: yeah. trying not to forget that

endings.title: GAME OVER: DEATH BY POWERPOINT
endings.subtitle: Ending 17/25
endings.s1:
You’re technically in tech. But your projects involve Excel macros and billing hours to middle managers who can’t open PDFs. You look polished in your ID photo. You feel... unfinished. But hey, your parents brag about you at dinner parties. That’s got to count for something. 

Right?
endings.s2:
You: built a dashboard that tells managers to open their email
Roommate: elite SaaS engineering
Best Friend: you doing okay? for real
You: yeah. just kind of feel like i’m LARPing
Roommate: corporate cosplay
Best Friend: still. you made it. that matters
You: yeah. maybe it does

endings.title: GAME OVER: COGS IN THE MACHINE
endings.subtitle: Ending 18/25
endings.s1:
The work is routine. CAN buses. Firmware. Testing protocols. You end most days sweaty and underappreciated, but satisfied. You’ve built something you can point to. Something real. 

Not many people get to say that.
endings.s2:
You: debugged a sensor issue today. car wouldn’t stop accelerating lol
Roommate: hell yeah. hardware supremacy
Best Friend: are YOU okay??
You: i got it working eventually. unfortunately, i don’t get to keep the car.
Best Friend: silent wins hit different
Roommate: yea but what’s life without a little flair?

endings.title: GAME OVER: LEGACY CODE, FORGOTTEN NAMES
endings.subtitle: Ending 19/25
endings.s1:
You’re not pushing the envelope. To be honest, you’re duct-taping it. But you show up. You keep things running. You quietly become indispensable among the grizzled ranks of engineers at Big Blue. No fanfare. No algorithmic glory. 

Just a paycheck, a title, and peace.
endings.s2:
You: taught myself how to use Lotus Notes. please pray for me
Roommate: ancient tech unlock
Best Friend: that’s actually kind of impressive
You: i think they’d hire me full-time just for knowing where the backups are
Roommate: that’s job security
Best Friend: low-key power move

endings.title: GAME OVER: OPTIMALLY EMPTY
endings.subtitle: Ending 20/25
endings.s1:
You spend half your time debugging internal tooling and the other half trying to explain to your manager what you’re actually building. It’s not the dream. But you’re on the board. And in a year like this? 

That counts.
endings.s2:
You: just watched a 14-slide deck about “the cloud” that said nothing
Roommate: classic fintech. jump ship lil bro
Best Friend: you okay though?
You: i mean yeah. it’s fine.
Best Friend: “fine” as in “soul dead”?
You: as in “i have dental now”
Roommate: reagan wins again

endings.title: GAME OVER: EMBEDDED IN OBSCURITY
endings.subtitle: Ending 21/25
endings.s1:
You clock in. You write drivers. You get home before 6. No all-nighters. No LinkedIn hustle. Just clean code and quiet wins. It’s not where you thought you’d be. But it’s solid. 

And it’s yours.
endings.s2:
You: l3’s been chill. not glamorous, but solid
Roommate: “not glamorous but solid” describes 90% of working in hardware
Best Friend: honestly that’s rare. hold onto it
You: i even get to touch the RF stuff sometimes
Roommate: okay now i’m jealous
Best Friend: we’re getting old aren’t we
You: terrifying

endings.title: GAME OVER: CLASSIFIED AND CONTENT
endings.subtitle: Ending 22/25
endings.s1:
Your badge gets you into rooms that don’t officially exist. You sign NDAs you don’t fully understand. The work is precise. The impact is… hard to think about. You don’t talk about your job at parties. 

But you sleep better than you used to.
endings.s2:
You: can’t tell if i’m building a missile system or just debugging hell
Roommate: if you disappear we’ll assume it was a drone strike
Best Friend: are you okay tho? fr
You: idk. but i’m good at it
Best Friend: that counts
Roommate: better than being broke tbh
You: that too

endings.title: GAME OVER: METICULOUS OVER MILLIMETERS
endings.subtitle: Ending 23/25
endings.s1:
The lab smells like melted filament and caffeine. You run tests. You fail prints. You iterate. The work is slow—but honest. You’re making something permanent. You don’t have someone to celebrate with. 

But you’re proud anyway.
endings.s2:
You: i just watched a 28-hour print collapse in the last 10 minutes
Best Friend: oh my god
Roommate: industrial L
You: don’t care. final design passed anyway
Best Friend: you’re lowkey thriving out there
You: weirdly yeah
Roommate: blue collar rizz

endings.title: GAME OVER: WALL STREET BLUES
endings.subtitle: Ending 24/25
endings.s1:
You live by the terminal now. You see the big boys, the fat cats of Wall Street, every day on your commute. 7:00 AM? Futures. 12:00 PM? Lunch + ML models. 6:00 PM? Yoga. Technically. There’s no one waiting for you at home. But that’s okay. You’re not just surviving anymore. You’re playing the game. 

And winning.
endings.s2:
You: cleared $10k in comp so far and haven’t spent a dollar
Roommate: fucking psychopath
Best Friend: don’t forget to be a person sometimes
You: already did
Roommate: bro is finance pilled
Best Friend: fr tho congrats. you made it
You: thanks. i’ll come visit when the boss lets me

endings.title: GAME OVER: SILICON VALLEY SOLILOQUY
endings.subtitle: Ending 14/25
endings.s1: The badge says Apple. The desk is sleek. The code compiles. You eat dinner alone most nights, but you’re not lonely. You’ve got your footing now. You’re making things that matter. The validation didn’t come from someone else this time. It came from you.
endings.s2:
You: first intern standup went fine. didn’t stutter once
Best Friend: he’s GROWING
Roommate: did they assign you a work wife yet
You: just me and this SwiftUI bug i’ve been dating for 3 days
Best Friend: proud of you fr
You: thanks. i kinda am too.

endings.title: GAME OVER: DEMO ENDING
endings.subtitle: Ending 26/25
endings.s1:
Thanks for playing the Demo! 

This is a placeholder ending for the demo version of the game. The full version will have more content (25 endings and 20+ questions) and features. Stay tuned for updates!

If you enjoyed this demo, please hire me.

Thank you for your support!
endings.s2:
You: so that’s it? demo’s over?
Best Friend: yeah… kinda hit too close to home, huh?
Roommate: dude it’s literally our lives. no internships, rejection emails...
You: why’d they make a game about our suffering?
Best Friend: because it’s *relatable*
You: tragic.
Roommate: at least in the game we got a support system
You: true. wish that counted for more

endings.title: GAME OVER: SMALL VICTORIES
endings.subtitle: Ending ??/25
endings.s1:
The internship isn't glamorous. It's a small office, a cluttered desk, and a manager who still uses Internet Explorer. But you show up. You learn. You figure things out.

She texts you after your first week: 'Proud of you.'

You're not where you thought you'd be. But you're somewhere. And that's enough.
endings.s2:
You: just finished my first week. survived.
Best Friend: that's huge actually
Roommate: local legend
You: she brought me lunch on friday
Best Friend: keeper status confirmed
Roommate: when's the wedding
You: lol shut up

endings.title: GAME OVER: THE LONG GAME
endings.subtitle: Ending ??/25
endings.s1:
The lab is quiet. The work is slow. But the professor trusts you with real problems, not just busywork.

It's not what you planned. But plans were always just educated guesses. This feels like learning. Like becoming something.

Maybe the path forward was never straight.
endings.s2:
You: running my first independent experiment tomorrow
Best Friend: SCIENTIST ARC
Roommate: bro's getting a phd next
You: calm down it's just undergrad research
Best Friend: still. proud of you
You: thanks. i'm kinda proud too

endings.title: GAME OVER: BREATHING ROOM
endings.subtitle: Ending ??/25
endings.s1:
The summer stretches out, empty and uncertain. No internship. No hustle. Just... time.

She's there. You go on walks. You cook together. You read books you've been meaning to finish.

It's not productive. But it's healing. And maybe that's what you needed all along.
endings.s2:
You: haven't opened linkedin in two weeks
Best Friend: honestly... good for you
Roommate: touch grass arc
You: she taught me how to make pasta from scratch
Best Friend: that's literally the dream
Roommate: ok that's cute actually

endings.title: GAME OVER: NOT ALONE
endings.subtitle: Ending ??/25
endings.s1:
The summer passes without fanfare. No big wins. No comeback story. Just two people figuring things out together.

She doesn't fix you. You don't fix her. But you make each other's bad days a little more bearable.

Sometimes that's the whole point.
endings.s2:
You: still don't know what i'm doing
Best Friend: none of us do
Roommate: fr
You: but she's here. that helps
Best Friend: that's everything honestly
Roommate: simp but valid

endings.title: GAME OVER: EMPTY SUMMER
endings.subtitle: Ending ??/25
endings.s1:
The summer passes in silence. No internship. No girlfriend. No grand plan.

You read. You sleep. You stare at job postings you don't apply to. It's not growth. It's just... survival.

But sometimes surviving is enough. Sometimes it has to be.
endings.s2:
You: summer's almost over. didn't do anything
Best Friend: that's okay man
Roommate: rest is underrated
You: doesn't feel like rest. feels like giving up
Best Friend: it's not. you're still here
Roommate: and next time you'll be ready
You: maybe. yeah. maybe
